name: St. Aloysius Gonzaga
summary: Aloysius Gonzaga was an Italian Jesuit novice who died at the age of 23 while caring for victims of a plague in Rome. Despite being born into a noble family, he renounced his inheritance to join the Jesuits. He is known for his purity, devotion, and self-sacrifice. He is the patron saint of youth, students, and those suffering from AIDS and other serious illnesses.
keyQuotes: I am a piece of twisted iron; I entered the religious life to get twisted straight.
